data.question: What is the title of the research article?
data.answer: Molecular Accordion: Vapoluminescence and Molecular Flexibility in the Orange and Green Luminescent Crystals of the Dimer, Au2(μ-bis-(diphenylphosphino)ethane)2Br2

data.question: Who are the authors of the research article?
data.answer: Sang Ho Lim, Marilyn M. Olmstead, and Alan L. Balch

data.question: What type of gold complexes change their luminescence or color in response to exposure to vapors of volatile organic compounds?
data.answer: Vapoluminescent and vapochromic transition metal complexes

data.question: What is the role of dppe in the complexes mentioned in the article?
data.answer: Dppe functions as a bridging ligand in all three types of crystals mentioned in the article.

data.question: What causes the variations in luminescence between the crystals of type A and B?
data.answer: The difference in luminescence between the crystals of type A and B can be ascribed largely to a difference in the Stokes’ shifts, with the green emitting crystals having a lesser Stokes’ shift.

data.question: True or False: The orange emitting crystalline polymers of type C polymers do not display variations in luminescence.
What happens to the luminescence of type A crystals of Au2(μ-dppe)2Br2·2(CH2Cl2) and Au2(μ-dppe)2Br2·2(OCMe2) upon exposure to air or drying in vacuum?
data.answer: They lose their orange emission and acquire a green luminescence.

data.question: True or False: Crystals of type B do not change their luminescence when exposed to air or vacuum.
What is the publication year of the research article?
True or False: The solvate molecules do not interact with the three-coordinate gold centers in the structures of the dimeric gold complex.
What is the effect of exposing the green luminescent crystals obtained after drying type A crystals to acetone vapor?
data.answer: Exposure to acetone vapor results in their conversion into orange-glowing crystals.

data.question: True or False: The Au2(μ-dppe)2Br2 molecule is remarkably flexible and able to function as a molecular accordion.
What is the role of aurophilic interactions in the complexes mentioned in the article?
data.answer: Aurophilic interactions, attractive interactions between gold centers, facilitate the formation of aggregates of two-coordinate gold(I) complexes.

data.question: True or False: The presence of various solvate molecules in the individual crystals does not appear to be associated with readily identifiable interactions such as coordination to gold or hydrogen bonding.

What is the expected outcome when the green luminescent crystals obtained after drying type A crystals are exposed to vapors of carbon disulfide, diethyl ether, benzene, acetonitrile, pyridine, nitromethane, dimethyl formamide, or dimethyl sulfoxide?
data.answer: They do not change their luminescence when exposed to vapors of these substances.

data.question: True or False: The approach of the two gold centers seen in the crystals of type B results in greater overlap of the out-of-plane pz orbitals.
What is the main focus of the research article?
data.answer: The main focus is on the vapoluminescence and molecular flexibility in the luminescent crystals of the dimer Au2(μ-bis-(diphenylphosphino)ethane)2Br2.

data.question: True or False: The orange emitting crystals of type C, which involve polymeric strands, show vapoluminescent behavior.
What is the significance of aurophilic interactions between three-coordinate gold(I) centers in the context of the article?
data.answer: The article presents the first evidence for the significance of aurophilic interactions between three-coordinate gold(I) centers where close contacts between the gold centers are not enforced by small-bite bridging ligands.

data.question: True or False: The article provides evidence that dppe can act as a chelating ligand in the complexes studied.
